noun.description: A traveling company of acrobats, clowns, and other entertainers which gives performances, typically in a large tent, in a series of different places.
(in ancient Rome) a rounded or oblong arena lined with tiers of seats, used for equestrian and other sports and games.
(in place names) a rounded open space in a city where several streets converge.

origin: Late Middle English (with reference to the arena of Roman antiquity): from Latin, ring or circus. The sense traveling company of performers dates from the late 18th century.
